forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As the twilight deepens over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle restlessness stirs among the clouds, hinting at the possibility of rain preceding dawn. Tonight, the air is thick with moisture, wrapping the city in a soft embrace as temperatures linger in the cool mid-fifties. Wisps of mist may dance through the streets, particularly near the bay, while the southwest wind murmurs, casting a refreshing chill that invites layers—perhaps a light sweater or a thin raincoat will prove prudent for evening endeavors. 

As the sun rises tomorrow, it will coax the clouds away, revealing a mostly sunny day ahead. The high will drift close to the cooler end of the spectrum, hovering around fifty-nine, nudging down to fifty-seven as the afternoon unfolds. A crisp westward breeze will accompany this, providing a sharp contrast to the harmonious warmth of the sun—ideal for a leisurely stroll through the alleys or a quiet time at a café where one can indulge in a steaming cup of coffee while observing the hustle of life. The sane pace of the city on such a day makes it an excellent opportunity to explore the little-known corners of Downtown, perhaps discovering a hidden bakery or a unique shop along the way.
